chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez was found guilty of Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Revoked (Cause Death), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge during the period of extended supervision as to Counts 3 and 4, cash bail to apply.
Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 18 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.
Concurrent with: concurrent with Counts 3 and 4 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

supervisions.notes: COUNTS 3 & 4:   Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge, and supervision fees during the period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.

Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant not to drive without a valid license.
Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 1.

No firearms; weapons.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: with credit for 7 days time served, concurrent to Count 1 and 3 and consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 11/25/2015. AR
Associated with Charge #4
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #1

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Thomas O., Jesse O., Patricia R. and Michael G.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with Counts 3 and 4 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 7 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge during the period of extended supervision as to Counts 3 and 4, cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment as ordered by the court.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 18 months.  Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 18 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.

AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, with credit for 7 days time served, concurrent to Count 1 and 4 and consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNT 4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 7 days time served, concurrent to Count 1 and 3 and consecutive to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:
 CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Defendant to participate in alcohol and drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* As to Counts 3 and 4, Court ordered defendant's driver's license revoked for a period of 5 years, concurrent to Count 1.
* Defendant not to drive without a valid license.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge, and supervision fees during the period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Alvaro Canseco-Hernandez in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Amended information, received and filed, amending count 1 to Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated - 2nd Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.63(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.  

AMENDED COUNT 1 and COUNT 3 & 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 2:
As a operation of law, court ordered count 2 DISMISSED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
